snippet: The short-story collection, often an underappreciated literary cousin of novels, is now enjoying the limelight, thanks to digital media.
abstract: Short story collections are experiencing a boom in popularity, driven by shifting tastes and new digital distribution options that favor short-form media; genre, which had languished alongside the decline of literary magazines, is now producing a regular crop of bestsellers.
lead_paragraph: The short-story collection, often an underappreciated literary cousin of novels, is now enjoying the limelight, thanks to digital media.
